text:
When a shtml document is requested and is parsed by the server, often the 
resultant delivered to the requesting browser is incomplete.  Often the server 
reports document not found.

hitting refresh on the browser will eventually deliver the page correctly.

The results are extremely intermittent with correctly formed pages being 
delivered as soon as I start the server, but as time elapses, the errors 
increase until practically nothing is delivered.

During this time, the CPU usage is increasing until it hits 100%.  At which 
time everything begins to grind to a halt.
creator: antony@interlandi.net

text:
Is there a personal firewall / virus scanner running?
Can you try the following directives:

EnableSendFile Off
EnableMMap Off
Win32DisableAcceptEx

(single or in combination)
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
I am using Nod32 AV software on the machine.
There is no firewall on this machine.

I had already tried EnableMMap Off without success

On your suggestion I tried EnableSendFile Off on its own without success.

Then as you suggested, I tried them both and instantly everything began 
working correctly.

I have not tried Win32DisableAcceptEx as yet and will only do so if I 
encounter problems again.

I will do some serious testing over the next 24 hours, and hopefully it will 
be all smiles at the end.

Thanks for your help.
creator: antony@interlandi.net

text: Cool, thanks for the feedback. I'm marking the report WORKSFORME then.
creator: nd@perlig.de
antony@interlandi.net
text:
After testing for the past 24 hours, I have not encountered any more parsing 
issues.

The assistance you gave was fantastic and I never expected so rapid a response.
Thank you again for your help.
